section.title: Description
section.p: There are many static source code checkers available and used by Open Source projects.

Splint is probably the most often used checker. It seamlessly integrates into the Visual C++ IDE. See the following documentation: . Unfortunately it is limited to C and is not able to parse C++ code.
Cppcheck is another Open Source software, which is able to parse C++ code and is therefore used for BUSMASTER.

section.title: Download
section.p: Cppcheck is available under: . Just download the most current version, e.g. cppcheck-1.50-x86-Setup.msi (as of 2011-10-25).

section.title: Installation
section.p: Execute the installer. The standard installation folder is C:\Program Files\Cppcheck\. Cppcheck should automatically be added to your %PATH% environment variable.

section.title: Configuration
section.p: There is no specific configuration of Cppcheck necessary.

section.title: Usage
section.p: Execute cppcheck -I. --enable=all %SOURCE_FILES% on the respective files. If you have git-bash or cygwin bash installed, you can do it over all .cpp and .h files using find -name "*.[cpp|h]" | xargs cppcheck -I. --enable=all *.cpp *.h.
